description.para: Checks and configures network interface address and parameters.

param.param_note: Network device defined in system core, usually it is network card.
Address for broadcasting messages to all machines in the subnet.

remarks.para: There are mainly two ways to use ifconfig:

1. ifconfig.exe [interface] or does not have any parameter. It is used to check network configuration of the current system. If no parameter is given, ifconfig displays the current valid interface mode. If single interface is given as parameter, only specified interface mode is displayed. If given parameter [-a], displays all interface modes including stopped interface.

2. ifconfig.exe interface address ..., IP address, network mask, and broadcasting address used to configure network interface. ifconfig is used to configure kernel resident network interface when bootstrap successful. After that it is only used when debugging or rearranging the system.

example.eg_note: Configures loop-back interface IP address and subnet mask.
Configures ethernet card IP address, subnet mask and broadcasting address.
